meanings.definition: Relating to or involved in a military expedition.
meanings.sent1: The expeditionary team prepared for their mission.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were part of the expeditionary force.
meanings.sent3: The expeditionary group had to march through the dense forest.
meanings.sent4: The expeditionary unit moved swiftly like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The expeditionary operation was executed with precision and skill.

meanings.sent1: The general led the expeditionary troops into enemy territory.
meanings.sent2: The sailors were part of the expeditionary fleet.
meanings.sent3: The expeditionary soldiers faced a surprise attack from squirrels.
meanings.sent4: The expeditionary journey was fraught with danger at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The expeditionary mission required courage and determination.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an expedition.
meanings.sent1: The explorers packed their expeditionary gear for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's work was focused on expeditionary research.
meanings.sent3: The expeditionary team discovered a new species of butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The expeditionary equipment was essential for the journey.
meanings.sent5: The expeditionary nature of the project required extensive planning.
